operation.descriptionCdata:
d0a0d6db-459d-4a6f-ae38-e7dff4b97348.description=
Filters XML based on provided criteria. If 'path' is specified, searches XML for all paths that match the specified 'path'. Paths can be specified from the root element or as an arbitrary path. Elements can be further filtered based on one of the following criteria. You can filter based on the existence of a specified child element or that child having a specific value. Similarly you can also filter based on the existence of a specified attribute or that attribute having a specified value. You can however only filter based on either a child element or an attribute. For complex filtering, please use the XPath Evaluator operation. 

Inputs\:
    xml - The XML (in the form of a String).
    path - The path to the element. This field is optional. The operation returns all children if this field is empty.
    isPathFromRoot - Decides whether the "path" input field is specified from the root 
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    childName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existence of a child element named "childName". This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childName" if the field is empty.
    childValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "childName" having this value. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childValue" if the field is empty.
    attributeName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existance of an attribute with the given "attributeName". This field is ptional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeName" if the field is empty.
    attributeValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "attributeName" having the value provided in this field. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeValue" if the field is empty.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Returns\:
    returnResult - The filtered elements.

Responses\:
    has more - Another Element was found, and has been returned.
    failure - Something went wrong.
    no more - No more Elements. This will only be returned once , then iteration restarts.

Notes\:
1. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).
2. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation.
3. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path.

Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\:
    xml\: 

                

                    Apples
                    Bananas
                 

            

    path\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"]
operation.name: XML Element Filter
